verses.roman:
grāme-grāmera patha chāḍi' yāya vane vane
kāya-mano-vākye cinte caitanya-caraṇe

synonyms: grāme-grāmera—from village to village; patha—the general path; chāḍi'-giving up; yāya—goes; vane vane—through the jungles; kāya-manaḥ-vākye—with body, mind and words; cinte—thinks; caitanya caraṇe—of the lotus feet of Śrī Caitanya Mahāprabhu.
translation: Giving up the general path from village to village, he passed through the jungles, thinking with heart and soul about the lotus feet of Śrī Caitanya Mahāprabhu.
